content: FHIRcast track's agenda for the Connectathon is published on Confluence and also in whova.

Are you planning on participating? If so, are you bring a hub, a client or both? To facilitate pre-connectathon testing, please share your Hub's endpoint! (Shoutout to Bas for already sharing his here).

cc / @Sahil Khanna

Nuance Hub info:

Nuance Integration Guide:
https://connect2.nuancepowerscribe.com/psonesetup/PO-PowerCastIntegrationGuide.pdf

Hub endpoint:
https://powercast.dev.nuancepowerscribe.com/api/hub

Hub swagger endpoint:
https://powercast.dev.nuancepowerscribe.com/swagger/index.html

  • Hub will support Subscribe endpoint HTTP GET at base url. Any/all events are allowed. NOTE: Subscribe response does NOT confirm to STU2, but rather returns a json object with two fields: "websocket_endpoint" and "context".
  • Hub will support Notify at baseurl/topic (HTTP Post) per specification
  • We can use a topic of your choice, or we can choose one at the time of testing
  • Nuance clients will use and respond to the following events: DiagnosticReport-open, DiagnosticReport-update, DiagnosticReport-close, userLogoff
  • subscribe and notify require OAuth2 access token in Authorization header as "Bearer".

I will post bearer tokens each day, they last 24 hrs.

We (George) was able to implement content sharing of media, so that will be testable for our Hub as well.
@Isaac Vetter Is there a recording of the track orientation?

@Isaac Vetter
Yes, we are participating in FHIRcast, and will be opting a role of client.

Hi Friends! Welcome to FHIR Connectathon 26! FHIRcast kickoff session is in 5 minutes, here: https://whova.com/portal/webapp/hlsfh_202101/Agenda/1428519

Are you having any technical troubles?

@Bas van den Heuvel and/or @Catie Ladd and/or @Sahil Khanna, @Manju Ravan - would you be interested in giving a short demo / walkthrough of your work with FHIRcast tomorrow, maybe at 10am Pacific (9a Eastern, 5p CET?, 9p IST?)
Sure

Fyi - there's two new FHIRcast sessions in our whova agenda for tomorrow and I changed tomorrow morning's standup. Here's the current sessions for tomorrow:

  • FHIRCast - well known Discovery & Deep Dive into Websockets - 7a Pacific
  • FHIRCast - Deep Dive on experimental Content Sharing - 9a Pacific
  • FHIRCast - Connectathon Demonstrations - 10a Pacific
  • FHIRcast - Case Study of FHIRcast in production: Ontario Health experience as an early innovator - 11a Pacific

These sessions will occur in the normal FHIRcast zoom. These sessions are designed to both engage participants beyond the core group of implementers, while also enabling implementers. Between and around these sessions, we should continue to do interop testing.

We've also a 15 minute Track Highlight/overview in the overall connectathon zoom at 8a Pacific. It will be very high level.
I can also give a demo.

@Isaac Vetter , @Bas van den Heuvel @Manju Ravan @Catie Ladd Testing with Nuance FHIRcast server status via webhook:

  1. subscription was successfully posted to HUB
  2. Callback URL verification was successful
  3. Event notification was send successfully to HUB
  4. Notification was received from HUB
@Catie Ladd can you please check logs from your end and confirm the same. We did capture the evidence.

@Bas van den Heuvel @Catie Ladd @Isaac Vetter @Sahil Khanna we are updating the web socket to absorb the feedback received over other tracks. We should be able to test with sockets once the change is in place.
Great work, @Sahil Khanna and @Manju Ravan! Hope you're able to get some sleep tonight!

Hi @Isaac Vetter @Bas van den Heuvel @Catie Ladd @Manju Ravan ...
The websockets are up and running. We did run similar test case which we performed with webhook and did receive response from FHIRcast Nuance server. We did capture the evidences.

Once the track opens today, we can demonstrate the same.

I wanted to say a big thank you to @Sahil Khanna and @Manju Ravan for the testing they did against our hub over the past couple of days. I know they put in a lot of work, and were determined to get working with both webhook and websocket connections and were successful! They also helped us uncover a couple of bugs with our webhook implementation, which is always appreciated. :)
Great work, FHIRcast participants! I've drafted our report-out on confluence. Feel free to edit as appropriate.
Looks good to me! Thanks for all the great sessions!

Thank you team, it was a great learning experience working with you all.
Thank you for making this happen!!!
